ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six looked at the bowls of another finding fault. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not look at the bowl of another finding fault,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.4_0: One should not look at the bowl of another finding fault.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, looks at the bowl of another finding fault, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.7.2_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.7.4_0: if he looks with the intention of giving or getting someone to give;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.9_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk38:1.10_0: The eighth training rule is finished.
